departments.name: African & African American Studies
departments.description: Researchers encompass anthropologists, economists, performance artists, literary critics, political scientists, philosophers, sociologists, historians, and art historians. Explores music, cultural studies, film, performance, popular culture, gender, sexuality, race, public policy and law.
graduate_programs: Certificate in African and African American Studies

departments.name: Air Force ROTC
departments.description: A commissioning program for the U.S. Air Force emphasizing aerospace defense studies, leadership and management, communications skills and professional knowledge.

departments.name: Army ROTC
departments.description: A commissioning program for the U.S. Army emphasizing academic scholarship, athletic ability and leadership.

departments.name: Art, Art History & Visual Studies
departments.description: Three distinct parts: Visual Arts, Art History, and Visual & Media Studies. Engaged in international research, interdisciplinary learning, and the study of visual culture.

departments.name: Asian & Middle Eastern Studies
departments.description: Explores Arabic, Chinese, Hebrew, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean culture through language and literature, social movements, nationalism, diaspora, popular culture, media, gender, visuality, feminism, film theory, cinema, aesthetics, and religion.
graduate_programs: Joint graduate certificate in Middle East Studies

departments.name: Biology
departments.description: Conducts research in ecology, functional biology at cell/molecular level, functional biology at organismal level, and evolutionary biology.

departments.name: Chemistry
departments.description: Research programs focus on chemical biology, nanomaterials, energy science, theoretical/computational chemistry, and molecular and biomolecular imaging.

departments.name: Classical Studies
departments.description: Explores languages (ancient Greek and Latin), literatures, archaeology, art history, and histories of Greco-Roman antiquity from 3000 BCE to 900 CE.
departments.geographic_scope: From the Nile to the North Sea, from Britain to Bactria

departments.name: Computer Science
departments.description: Top 25 department emphasizing geometric computing, internet systems, networking & security, memory systems, biological computing, and learning & modeling.
undergraduate_programs: Minor in Computational Biology and Bioinformatics

departments.name: Cultural Anthropology
departments.description: Top program exploring globalization, diaspora, popular culture, mass media, nationalism, identity, race, sexuality, and politics of tradition and modernity.

departments.name: Dance
departments.description: Internationally-recognized choreographers, scholars, teachers and performers offering high-caliber dance training and scholarship.

departments.name: Economics
departments.description: Rapidly approaching top ten programs nationally. Broadly focused on econometrics, micro- and macro-economic theory, and applied economics.
graduate_programs: M.S. in Statistical and Economic Modeling

departments.name: Education
departments.description: Accredited program offering teacher certification and preparation programs.

departments.name: English
departments.description: Top ten English department working in different historical periods and national political contexts.

departments.name: Evolutionary Anthropology
departments.description: Focuses on understanding non-human primate and human biology in an evolutionary context.

departments.name: Gender, Sexuality & Feminist Studies
departments.description: Explores gender identities, relations, practices, theories and institutions.
research_themes: Intersectionality of gender, race and class

departments.name: German Studies
departments.description: Research spans German ethics, intellectual history, theory, philosophy, literary history and criticism, and cultural studies.
additional_programs: Duke in Berlin global education program

departments.name: Health, Wellness & Physical Education
departments.description: Provides academic opportunities through activity and lecture-based theory classes.

departments.name: History
departments.description: Among the top programs nationally with extensive regional and thematic specializations.

departments.name: International Comparative Studies
departments.description: Helps students create coherent programs emphasizing critical transnationalism through interdisciplinary coursework.

departments.name: Linguistics
departments.description: Unique inter-disciplinary program offering undergraduate education that is both deep and broad.

departments.name: Literature
departments.description: National leader in theory, philosophy and politics of literature and media within a global and postcolonial framework.

departments.name: Mathematics
departments.description: Research spans theoretical to applied mathematics. Top 20 for pure mathematics, top 15 for applied mathematics.

departments.name: Music
departments.description: Faculty includes musicologists, composers, ethnomusicologists, and performers.

departments.name: Navy ROTC
departments.description: A commissioning program for the U.S. Navy emphasizing naval science, physical competence, and leadership.

departments.name: Philosophy
departments.description: Strong faculty committed to excellence in research and teaching with particular strengths in several areas.

departments.name: Physics
departments.description: Research ranges from astrophysics to condensed matter physics. Top 6 for nuclear physics, top 30 for physics.

departments.name: Political Science
departments.description: Among top ten programs nationally for many years.

departments.name: Psychology & Neuroscience
departments.description: Internationally known for leadership in cognitive science and clinical psychology.
graduate_programs: PhD Program in Psychology and Neuroscience

departments.name: Religious Studies
departments.description: Very distinguished nationally, exploring social organization and impact of religion in ancient and modern cultures.
graduate_programs: Graduate Program in Religion (with Divinity School)
areas_of_expertise: Religion in culture, law and contemporary thought

departments.name: Romance Studies
departments.description: National leader for integrating study of literature and language, covering Spanish, French, Portuguese, and Italian cultures.
undergraduate_majors: Spanish, Latin American, and Latino/a Studies
affiliated_certificates: Latino/a Studies in the Global South

departments.name: Slavic & Eurasian Studies
departments.description: Explores cultures and histories of Russia and Central/Eastern Europe.
research_topics: Polish language, literature, film, popular culture

departments.name: Sociology
departments.description: Ranked among top 12 and rapidly approaching top ten programs.

departments.name: Statistical Science
departments.description: Top 10 program and premier Bayesian statistics program in the world.
departments.focus: Leading the data and computational revolution

departments.name: Theater Studies
departments.description: Combines study of history, theory of theater, performance and dramatic literature with development of new works and new media integration.

departments.name: Thompson Writing Program
departments.description: Ranked among top five writing programs in the country, exploring impacts of written, oral, and digital rhetoric.
departments.undergraduate_offerings: Courses in written, verbal, and digital communication
departments.graduate_offerings: Courses and programming for writing excellence and teaching

majors.name: Biomedical Engineering
majors.description: Take on societally critical challenges in biology and health care, including the design of medical technology.

majors.name: Civil Engineering
majors.description: Lead the Fifth Industrial Revolution—designing solutions aimed at broadly-shared well-being, for people and the planet.

majors.name: Electrical & Computer Engineering
majors.description: Integrate computing and electronic knowledge with design skill to create new devices and software.

majors.name: Environmental Engineering
majors.description: Develop systems and structures that restore and protect the planet's air, water and soil.

majors.name: Mechanical Engineering
majors.description: Invent machines that improve lives, in fields as varied as health care, manufacturing, energy and transportation.

majors.name: IDEAS
majors.description: Explore a topic important to you through a customized major—pick a pre-approved template or propose your own.
